Articles.Content:
Here's my Delta 6925-8, which flew 14 times with no failures from 1989 to 1992. I've kept the scale to just about 100%. My Star 48 SRB has about 304 m/s of Delta-V, and the SRB on the HS-376 has 404 (Hard to do SRB equipped maneuvers without knowing Delta-V after all!). This Recreation was built in 1.0, so it may have too little delta-v in 1.0.2. For GTO insertion, use the Delta-K stage till you have 305 m/s left, stage, then fire the Star 48.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Download http://kerbalx.com/SaturnianBlue/Delta-6925-8+HS-376

Edited June 13, 2015 by SaturnianBlue

Here's a sneak peek at my next version of the rocket, the Delta 6925 (Without the "Straight eight" fairing, and instead the metallic fairing) with my GPS Block II spacecraft, basically the payload the Delta II first launched.

This is really accurate and incredibe - Repped!

Good work

Here is my Delta II 6925, almost the same as the rocket above, but with another fairing, GPS, and a Star 27 SRB. This time the GPS is a stowed version.
